entry.et: Middle English cotage, from Anglo-French, from Middle English cot cot

def.dt: :the dwelling of a farm laborer or small farmer
:a small detached dwelling unit at an institution
:a usually small house for vacation use
:a bland soft white cheese made from the curds of skim milk called also Dutch cheese pot cheese smearcase
:a double set of upper and lower straight-hanging window curtains
:an industry whose labor force consists of family units or individuals working at home with their own equipment
:a small and often informally organized industry
:a limited but enthusiastically pursued activity or subject this debate about sex and law became a cottage industry for feminist academics Wendy Kaminer
:a shepherd's pie made especially with beef
:plain cake covered with a hot sweet sauce
city E Minnesota SE of St. Paul pop 30,582
:a compact rectangular dwelling of one or one-and-a-half stories usually with a central chimney and steep gable roof called also cape Cape Cod
:a cottage or house owned by an employer (as a farmer) and reserved for occupancy by an employee
